content: heartstrings a variety of crochet trims | designed by lisa hounshell this pattern uses breakaway crochet method techniques if you haven t done so already please refer to the following instructional material before attempting this pattern for the basic techniques start by either downloading the free training wheels primer ebook from ravelry com or by watching this video tutorial you will also need to understand the concepts shown in the 2-round motif video tutorial 2-round motif video tutorial materials yarn many types of yarn can be used but it really depends how you will use the heart strings generally cotton is a good choice for stand-alone type projects or for appliques if using in conjunction with a crochet project such as a blanket border then match the yarn you are using for the main project hook it is also recommended to use the hook size that is appropriate for the yarn check the label on the yarn if you are not sure locking stitch marker pattern notes video tutorials for these trims available on youtube instructions are given for 3 different small motifs which can be joined together in many different ways included are a small heart that is worked in one round a large heart that is worked in two rounds and a divider motif which is essentially a mini training wheel the motifs can be joined in two different orientations side-by-side to make a horizontal string or stacked one on top of the other for a vertical string you can put as many motifs as you want within each string 1 once orientation is decided you can then plan on repeating just one motif for the entire string or mix and match the motifs in any sequence you desire shown here are small and large vertical strings and small and large horizontal strings to fully understand some of the more unusual concepts described in these instructions please see the accompanying youtube playlist see video symbols and abbreviations us terminology fr floating ring floating slip_stitch - make a floating ring but finish it by drawing the last yarn fss over through all 3 loops instead of the usual 2 video tutorial floating single_crochet make floating ring yo and draw through 2 loops on fsc hook video tutorial floating treble_crochet yo twice make floating ring yo and draw through ftc 2 loops 3 times multiple floating ring secure loop on hook with a locking stitch marker yo mfr 3 times make floating ring yo and draw through 2 loops 3 times 2 loops remaining on hook drop the secured loop off of the hook restore single_crochet at end of first round drop loop off hook put rsc secured loop back on hook put dropped loop back on hook remove stitch marker yo and draw through 2 loops to complete a single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch a slip stich around the connecting strands between motifs 2 chain chain stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet 2 stitches together yo 2 times
